items.title: Revolutionizing the Way Businesses Optimize Their Systems
items.desc:
OpenObserve is a technology company that provides innovative solutions for modern businesses. OpenObserve's mission is to empower organizations to optimize their systems, streamline their operations, and make data-driven decisions. The company's solutions are designed to help businesses unlock the full potential of their data by providing advanced search and observability technologies

OpenObserve is committed to providing exceptional customer service and support to its customers. The company works closely with its customers to understand their unique business needs and provide tailored solutions that meet those needs.With OpenObserve, businesses can rest assured that they have a reliable partner in their technology journey.

items.title: Experience the Next Generation of Observability and Search Technology
items.desc: OpenObserve's innovative products include OpenObserve, a cutting-edge open-source observability platform designed for the cloud, kubernetes and bare metal alike that allows you to monitor your logs, metrics, and traces with ease. zPlane offers an enterprise version of OpenObserve for large businesses to meet their complex requirements. Both products offer exceptional cost savings and top-notch performance, enabling businesses to gain valuable insights into their systems' health and ultimately improve their software's quality.

jobs.title: Software developer - Rust
jobs.description:
Location: Remote (US timezone: GMT-5 to GMT-8 time zone)

Salary Range: $100,000 - $140,000 + Stock Options


Company Overview:

OpenObserve is a leading player in the world of open source observability tools, backed by renowned venture capitalists such as Nexus Ventures and Dell Technologies Capital. With our unique offering of combining logs, metrics, and traces into a single platform, we've made our mark in the tech industry. We are the only tool that comes with a single binary that enables anyone to get started in less than 2 minutes. OpenObserve is proudly a fully remote team with team members spread across the globe.


Role Overview:

We are seeking a talented and motivated Rust Developer to join our fast-growing team. This role will focus on enhancing and expanding our single-platform tool. Our ideal candidate is someone who thrives in a remote work environment, is comfortable with the fast-paced nature of a growing startup, and is located within the US timezone.


Responsibilities:

  • Write clean, maintainable, and efficient Rust code to enhance our observability tool.
  • Work with the OpenObserve team to design and implement new features and services.
  • Provide technical guidance and insight to team members and stakeholders.
  • Maintain and improve the performance of existing software.
  • Develop comprehensive testing suites to ensure the reliability and consistency of our software.
  • Collaborate with the team to manage and prioritize project components.


Requirements:

  • Proven experience as a Rust developer.
  • Familiarity with open-source projects and the open-source community.
  • Strong understanding of distributed systems and observability tools.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
  • Able to meet deliverables and drive your work to completion within specified timelines.
  • Great communication skills and the ability to work well with a remote, distributed team.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with log, metrics, or trace observability.
  • Knowledge of other programming languages like Go, Python, or JavaScript.
  • Familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Familiarity with continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) practices.


Benefits:

  • Fully remote position.
  • Competitive salary range: $100,000 - $140,000.
  • Stock options.
  • The opportunity to work with a high-growth, groundbreaking technology company.

OpenObserve is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
